page.title: 07ENERGY AND HOUSING
page.content: In the area of Preston Capes there are approx. 70 dwellings of which approx. l2 are rented from either the Daventry District Council of private landlords. The well-kept gardens, lawns and verges, make Preston Capes and Little Preston attractive and sought after villages despite the fact that there is no main drainage, no mains gas - bottled gas for portable heaters and cookers is used by some people -no street lighting, shop or public house. Oil, delivered by tanker is a common form of central heating. The village formed part of the Fawsley Estate until l932 when most of the properties were sold, at which time many of the houses had thatched roofs although there are only two remaining. The area is now a Conservation Area.
